result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Sconzert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond applied  -  PAID IN FULL

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
May not have contact with Laura Inman, unless agent deems it appropriate.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
May not have contact with Laura Inman, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Aileen Henry. Information filed previously. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Henry. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Not guilty plea entered. Judicial pretrial on 1-9-15 @ 8:50am. Bond continued.
Scheduling Order
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Henry. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman.
modified
Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to possess of consume controlled substances without a prescription. No violent contact and no discussion of this case with Laura I.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Aileen Henry. Clerk LE. KPD Officer Austin Hancock sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Henry. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Arraignment on Atty. Henry requests modification of bond conditions. State waives notice requirements. Court amends bond conditions to change no contact with Laura I. to no violent contact with Laura I. and no discussion of this case with Laura I. Amended bond signed in court.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared by Atty. Aileen Henry. Clerk LE. No appearance by def. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Court received message from def.'s probation officer stating def. has been in bicycle accident and is in emergency room, unable to appear for preliminary hearing. Court tolls time limits due to unavailability of def. Bench warrant authorized with $2500 cash bond, but stayed until 11-14-14 @ 9:00am. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 11-14-14 @ 9:00am.
Atty Aileen Henry

156 p.m.  Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Rufo. Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 11/4/14 @ 915 a.m.   $2500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/Laura I or her residence.
